ISSUE.TITLE: podman build --file does not actually accept a URL
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description > --file, -f=Containerfile > Specifies a Containerfile which contains instructions for building the image, either a local file **or an http or https URL**. If more than one Containerfile is specified, FROM instructions are only be accepted from the last specified file. ### Steps to reproduce the issue ``` $ podman build --file=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/containers/buildah/main/tests/bud/base-with-arg/Containerfile . ``` ### Describe the results you received ``` Error: stat /var/tmp/libpod_builder598674354/build/https:/raw.githubusercontent.com/containers/buildah/main/tests/bud/base-with-arg/Containerfile: no such file or directory ``` ### Describe the results you expected The Containerfile is pulled from the web and used. ### podman info output ```yaml host: arch: arm64 buildahVersion: 1.32.0 cgroupControllers: - COMMIT.MESSAGE: podman build --remote URI Dockerfile shoud not be treated as file Podman build --remote is translating https://path as if it was a file path. This change will leave it as a URL so it can be parsed on the server side. Fixed: https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/20475 Signed-off-by: Daniel J Walsh <dwalsh@redhat.com>
